meanings.definition: The state of being adjacent or next to something else.
meanings.sent1: The adjacency of the two houses made it easy for the neighbors to chat over the fence.
meanings.sent2: The adjacency of the park to the school allowed for quick and easy access to outdoor activities.
meanings.sent3: The adjacency of the cat to the fishbowl led to a comical chase around the living room.
meanings.sent4: The adjacency of the mountains to the lake created a breathtaking view for all to enjoy.
meanings.sent5: The adjacency of the bus stop to the cafe made it convenient for commuters to grab a quick coffee.

meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being adjacent.
meanings.sent1: The adjacency of the buildings was crucial for the city's urban planning.
meanings.sent2: The adjacency of the rooms in the house made it feel cozy and connected.
meanings.sent3: The adjacency of the ice cream shop to the gym was a tempting challenge for those trying to stay fit.
meanings.sent4: The adjacency of the colors in the painting created a harmonious and pleasing effect.
meanings.sent5: The adjacency of the playground to the schoolyard brought joy to the children during recess.

meanings.sent1: The adjacency of the cars in the parking lot made it difficult to find a spot.
meanings.sent2: The adjacency of the ingredients on the counter made cooking dinner a breeze.
meanings.sent3: The adjacency of the keys to the door saved time when rushing out in the morning.
meanings.sent4: The adjacency of the players on the field allowed for quick passes and teamwork.
meanings.sent5: The adjacency of the books on the shelf made it easy to find the one she was looking for.
